newsitem.title: KENYA: Strong inflows keep Kenya shilling buoyant.
newsitem.headline: Strong inflows keep Kenya shilling buoyant.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling was buoyant on strong dollar inflows Friday in quiet trading, commercial bank dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted mean shilling average of 54.88 against the dollar from 54.97 while on the pound, the shilling was posted at 92.96 from 94.03.
Dealers said the shilling was boosted by inflows streaming in from coffee and the tourism sector coupled by a lack of dollar-buying interest.
"It looks like the dollars from the coffee sector are still in the market," one dealer said. "Demand has not yet come in."
Another dealer said the shilling's appreciation against other leading currencies was a reflection of the pound weakening against the greenback in the international market.
Some dealers said trading was quiet because most players were still closed for Christmas and New Year holidays.
They expected acitivity to pick next week when normal business resumes.
The money market was very liquid with most banks seeking to lend funds. Overnight rates were quoted as low as six percent.
